definitions: transfer of heat through direct contact between molecules in a material
transmission of electrical current through a conducting medium or material
propagation of nerve impulses along neural pathways through electrochemical processes
examples: Metal handles demonstrate excellent heat conduction during cooking processes
The conduction of warmth through the floor made winter evenings comfortable
Copper's superior conduction makes it ideal for electrical wiring systems
Poor conduction in damaged cables caused frequent power interruptions
Nerve conduction studies help diagnose peripheral neuropathy in patients
The conduction velocity decreased significantly after the nerve injury

definitions: measure of a material's ability to conduct electric current efficiently
capacity of a material to transfer heat through molecular interaction
ability of a solution to conduct electricity through dissolved ions
examples: Silver has the highest electrical conductivity among common metals
The conductivity meter showed unusually high readings in the water
Materials with low thermal conductivity make excellent insulators for buildings
The conductivity of ceramics varies greatly with their composition
Measuring water conductivity helps assess dissolved mineral content accurately
The conductivity increased sharply after adding salt to the solution

definitions: person who directs an orchestra or choir through gestures and interpretation
material that allows electricity to flow through it with minimal resistance
railway employee who manages passengers and collects tickets on trains
substance that readily transmits heat energy through molecular interaction
examples: The conductor raised his baton to begin the symphony performance
She studied under famous conductors in Vienna and Berlin
Copper remains the most common conductor in household electrical systems
Semiconductors behave as conductors under specific temperature conditions
The conductor punched tickets while walking through the train cars
Passengers asked the conductor about arrival times at various stations
Metals are excellent conductors of both heat and electricity
Poor conductors like wood make effective thermal insulators

definitions: tube or pipe protecting electrical wires or cables from damage
means through which information, resources, or influence passes between parties
artificial channel or pipe for conveying water or other fluids
examples: Electricians installed metal conduit to protect wiring in the walls
The conduit system prevented moisture damage to sensitive electrical components
The embassy served as a conduit for diplomatic communications
Social media became a powerful conduit for spreading political messages
Ancient Romans built stone conduits to transport water across valleys
The underground conduit carries treated water to residential neighborhoods

definitions: three-dimensional shape with circular base tapering to a point
woody seed-bearing structure produced by coniferous trees like pines
crisp wafer shaped into a cone for holding ice cream
orange plastic marker used to direct traffic or mark boundaries
photoreceptor cell in the retina responsible for color vision
examples: Students calculated the volume of a cone using mathematical formulas
The volcano formed a perfect cone shape against the skyline
Pine cones scattered across the forest floor after the storm
Children collected decorative cones for their holiday craft projects
The ice cream cone dripped in the summer heat
She ordered a double scoop in a waffle cone
Construction workers placed orange cones around the work zone
Traffic cones directed drivers away from the accident scene
Cone cells enable humans to perceive millions of different colors
Damage to cone receptors can result in color blindness

definitions: sweet food item made with sugar, chocolate, or other confectionery ingredients
elaborate or frivolous creation in fashion, art, or entertainment
examples: The pastry chef created delicate confections for the wedding reception
Belgian chocolate confections filled the display case at the boutique
Her wedding dress was a confection of silk and handmade lace
The musical was a delightful confection of comedy and romance

definitions: person who makes or sells candies, chocolates, and other sweet treats professionally
examples: The confectioner crafted handmade truffles for the chocolate shop
Local confectioners competed in the annual candy-making championship

definitions: candies, chocolates, and other sweet foods considered collectively as products
shop or business establishment that sells candies and sweet treats
examples: The confectionery industry generates billions in revenue each year
Children pressed their noses against windows displaying colorful confectionery
The old-fashioned confectionery on Main Street attracted tourists daily
She opened a confectionery specializing in handmade chocolates and fudge

definitions: alliance of states, groups, or peoples united for mutual support or action
group of people united for illegal or unethical purposes
examples: The Southern Confederacy fought against the Union during the Civil War
Several tribes formed a confederacy to resist colonial expansion
Police uncovered a confederacy involved in international drug trafficking
The confederacy of corrupt officials was finally exposed by journalists

definitions: person or group united with others in an alliance or confederation
person who assists another in committing a crime or wrongdoing
soldier who fought for the Confederate States during the American Civil War
examples: The confederates agreed to share resources during the economic crisis
Several nations acted as confederates in the peace negotiations
The thief's confederate distracted the guard while he opened the safe
Prosecutors charged three confederates in the embezzlement scheme
Confederate soldiers wore gray uniforms during the Civil War
The museum displayed artifacts from Confederate and Union forces

definitions: union of sovereign states united for purposes of common action
alliance of organizations or groups working together for shared goals
examples: The Swiss Confederation has maintained neutrality for centuries
The confederation allowed member states to retain significant autonomy
The confederation of labor unions organized nationwide strikes for better wages
Sports clubs formed a confederation to negotiate broadcasting rights collectively

definitions: formal meeting of people with shared professional interests for discussion and presentation
group of sports teams organized for regular competition
meeting for consultation or discussion of specific matters
examples: Scientists presented groundbreaking research at the annual medical conference
The technology conference attracted thousands of developers from worldwide
Their team leads the eastern conference in total victories this season
Conference championships determine which teams advance to the playoffs
The principal called a conference with parents to discuss student behavior
Department heads held weekly conferences to coordinate project timelines

definitions: formal statement admitting guilt or wrongdoing, especially to authorities
religious practice of acknowledging sins to a priest for absolution
intimate revelation of personal thoughts, feelings, or secrets
examples: The suspect signed a confession after hours of police interrogation
Her confession led to the conviction of several co-conspirators
Catholics attend confession regularly to receive spiritual forgiveness
The priest heard confessions every Saturday afternoon before mass
His memoir reads like a confession of past mistakes and regrets
She made a tearful confession about her struggles with addiction

definitions: enclosed booth in a church where priests hear confessions privately
style of writing or art revealing intimate personal experiences
examples: The ornate wooden confessional stood in the corner of the cathedral
Parishioners waited in line outside the confessional on Saturday afternoons
Her poetry represents the confessional style popularized in the 1960s
The artist's confessional paintings revealed deep psychological struggles

definitions: priest authorized to hear confessions and grant absolution in the Catholic Church
person who suffered for their faith but did not die as a martyr
examples: The confessor provided spiritual guidance to troubled parishioners
She chose the same confessor her family had trusted for generations
Edward the Confessor was canonized for his piety and religious devotion
Medieval confessors endured persecution without renouncing their faith

definitions: small pieces of colored paper thrown during celebrations and festive occasions
examples: Confetti rained down on the newlyweds as they left the church
Cleanup crews swept pounds of confetti from Times Square after midnight

definitions: person with whom one shares secrets or private matters in complete trust
examples: She remained his closest confidant throughout his political career
The CEO relied on a small circle of confidants for honest advice

definitions: woman with whom one shares secrets or private matters in complete trust
examples: Her sister became her primary confidante during the difficult divorce
The queen's confidante knew all the palace intrigues and secrets

definitions: feeling of self-assurance arising from appreciation of one's abilities or qualities
firm trust or belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something
information shared privately with expectation it will not be disclosed
examples: Her confidence grew with each successful presentation to the board
Athletes need confidence to perform well under competitive pressure
Investors showed renewed confidence in the company's leadership team
The public's confidence in democratic institutions has declined recently
She shared the information in strict confidence with her lawyer
The document was marked as a confidence between diplomatic partners

definitions: state of keeping information secret or private, especially in professional contexts
examples: Doctor-patient confidentiality protects medical information from unauthorized disclosure
The company required all employees to sign confidentiality agreements

definitions: particular arrangement of parts or elements in a specific form or figure
way a computer system or software application is set up
examples: The molecular configuration determines the compound's chemical properties
Engineers tested various configurations of the aircraft's wing design
The network configuration required updating after installing new hardware
System administrators documented the server configuration for troubleshooting

definitions: state of being imprisoned or kept within limits of space or movement
period before, during, and after childbirth when a woman rests
examples: Solitary confinement affects prisoners' mental health significantly
The judge ordered confinement to home with electronic monitoring
Traditional confinement practices vary across different cultures worldwide
She observed a month of confinement after delivering her baby

definitions: action of confirming something as true, accurate, or valid
religious rite admitting a baptized person to full church membership
formal approval or acceptance of an appointment or agreement
examples: Email confirmation of your reservation will arrive within 24 hours
Scientists sought confirmation of their hypothesis through repeated experiments
The bishop performed confirmation ceremonies for teenage church members
She wore a white dress for her confirmation at the cathedral
Senate confirmation of the nominee required a simple majority vote
The board awaited confirmation of the merger from regulatory authorities

definitions: official taking of private property by authorities as penalty or for public use
examples: The court ordered confiscation of assets obtained through illegal activities
Airport security announced confiscation of prohibited items from luggage

definitions: extensive fire that destroys a great deal of land or property
large-scale conflict or war involving many nations or groups
examples: The conflagration destroyed hundreds of homes in the California wildfire
Firefighters battled the conflagration for three days before containing it
World War I began as a regional dispute but became a global conflagration
Diplomatic efforts prevented the border skirmish from becoming a wider conflagration

definitions: serious disagreement or argument between people with opposing views
prolonged armed struggle between states, groups, or military forces
incompatibility between two or more opinions, principles, or interests
examples: The conflict between management and workers led to a strike
Family conflicts intensified during the holiday gathering
The military conflict displaced millions of civilians from their homes
International observers monitored the conflict zone for ceasefire violations
Her work schedule created a conflict with family obligations
The lawyer identified a conflict of interest in representing both parties

definitions: point where two rivers or streams flow together to form one
coming together of people, things, or events at one point
examples: The town developed at the confluence of two major rivers
Ecologists studied biodiversity at the confluence of the tributaries
The festival represents a confluence of different cultural traditions
A confluence of factors led to the economic crisis

definitions: act of conforming to or meeting rules, standards, or laws
examples: Quality inspectors verified conformance with safety regulations
The software achieved conformance with international accessibility standards

definitions: shape or structure of something, especially an animal's body or molecular arrangement
action of conforming or producing conformity in form or character
examples: The horse's conformation made it ideal for show jumping competitions
Scientists studied the protein's conformation using x-ray crystallography
The building's conformation to local architectural styles pleased residents
Strict conformation to safety protocols prevented workplace accidents

definitions: person who conforms to accepted behavior or established social conventions
examples: The corporate culture rewarded conformists who followed company policies precisely
She rejected her conformist upbringing to pursue an artistic career

definitions: behavior in accordance with socially accepted conventions or standards
compliance with rules, standards, or regulations
examples: Peer pressure often leads teenagers toward conformity in dress and behavior
The study examined conformity within different cultural contexts
Product conformity with safety standards is mandatory before market release
Building inspectors checked conformity with local construction codes

definitions: hostile or argumentative meeting between opposing parties or viewpoints
act of directly challenging or facing someone about an issue
examples: The confrontation between protesters and police escalated into violence
Diplomatic efforts aimed to prevent military confrontation between nations
She dreaded the confrontation with her supervisor about missed deadlines
The intervention required careful confrontation of his addiction issues

definitions: state of being bewildered or unclear in one's mind about something
situation of panic, disorder, or upheaval caused by unexpected events
examples: The complex instructions caused confusion among new employees
Her confusion about the directions led to arriving late
The sudden evacuation created confusion at the airport terminal
Mass confusion erupted when contradictory announcements were made

definitions: Cuban dance of African origin performed with a syncopated rhythm
tall, narrow, single-headed drum played with the hands
line dance where participants hold the person in front while moving
examples: Musicians played traditional conga rhythms at the Cuban festival
She learned the conga steps during her vacation in Havana
The percussionist's conga drums added authentic Latin flavor to the band
He bought a set of conga drums for his home studio
Wedding guests formed a conga line that wound through the reception hall
The conga line at the office party lasted for twenty minutes

definitions: excessive accumulation of traffic causing slow movement or stoppage
blockage of nasal passages due to inflammation or excess mucus
overcrowding of a network resulting in performance degradation
examples: Rush hour congestion added two hours to the normal commute time
The city implemented congestion pricing to reduce downtown traffic
Allergy medication helped relieve her sinus congestion significantly
Steam inhalation can provide temporary relief from nasal congestion
Network congestion caused delays in data transmission during peak hours
The server experienced congestion when thousands of users logged in simultaneously

definitions: large corporation formed by merging of separate and diverse firms
coarse-grained sedimentary rock composed of rounded fragments cemented together
collection or mixture of different things or people
examples: The media conglomerate owns newspapers, television stations, and film studios
International conglomerates dominate many sectors of the global economy
Geologists identified ancient conglomerate formations along the riverbed
The conglomerate rock contained pebbles from various geological periods
The neighborhood was a conglomerate of different ethnic communities
Her art represented a conglomerate of various cultural influences

definitions: collection or gathering of different things or people into a mass
process of forming into a coherent mass or collection
examples: The city center was a conglomeration of architectural styles from different eras
The festival attracted a conglomeration of artists, musicians, and performers
The conglomeration of small businesses into a single entity took years
Gradual conglomeration of settlements formed the modern metropolis

definitions: region in Central Africa or countries named after it
Cuban dance similar to the conga with African origins
examples: The Congo River is the second longest river in Africa
Both Congo republics share a complex colonial history
Traditional congo rhythms influenced modern Latin music significantly
Dancers performed the congo at the Caribbean cultural festival

definitions: group of people assembled for religious worship, especially in church
gathering or collection of people, animals, or things
examples: The congregation sang hymns during the Sunday morning service
The pastor addressed the congregation about upcoming charity events
A congregation of protesters gathered outside the government building
Birdwatchers observed a large congregation of migrating geese

definitions: male member of the United States House of Representatives or similar legislative body
examples: The congressman introduced legislation to improve healthcare access
Local congressman held town halls to hear constituent concerns

definitions: female member of the United States House of Representatives or similar legislative body
examples: The congresswoman championed education reform throughout her career
First-term congresswoman quickly gained influence on key committees

definitions: exact correspondence of shape and size between geometric figures
state of agreement, harmony, or compatibility between things
examples: Students proved the congruence of triangles using side-angle-side theorem
Mathematical congruence requires all corresponding parts to be equal
The congruence between their values strengthened their partnership
Researchers found congruence between the two independent studies

definitions: tree bearing cones and needle-like or scale-like leaves, mostly evergreen
examples: Conifers dominate the northern forests of Canada and Russia
The landscaper recommended planting conifers for year-round privacy screening

definitions: opinion or conclusion formed on the basis of incomplete information
mathematical statement believed true but not yet proven
examples: Media conjecture about the merger proved premature and inaccurate
Her conjecture about the suspect's motive guided the investigation
Goldbach's conjecture remains unproven after nearly three centuries
The mathematician spent years trying to prove the conjecture

definitions: variation of verb forms to express tense, mood, person, and number
temporary union of organisms for exchange of genetic material
alternating single and multiple bonds in organic chemistry
examples: Students memorized Spanish verb conjugation patterns for the exam
Irregular conjugation makes English challenging for language learners
Bacterial conjugation transfers antibiotic resistance between cells
Scientists observed conjugation in paramecia under the microscope
The conjugation system in benzene creates exceptional stability
Extended conjugation produces the bright colors in many dyes

definitions: word used to connect clauses, sentences, or words in the same clause
apparent meeting or passing of two celestial bodies in the sky
combination of events or circumstances happening at the same time
examples: Common conjunctions include 'and', 'but', and 'or' in English
The conjunction 'because' introduces a reason or explanation
Astronomers predicted the conjunction of Jupiter and Saturn
The planetary conjunction created a spectacular celestial display
The conjunction of several factors led to the economic boom
Success resulted from a fortunate conjunction of talent and opportunity

definitions: performance of tricks that appear to defy natural laws using sleight of hand
practice of summoning spirits or supernatural entities
examples: The magician's conjuring amazed children at the birthday party
Professional conjuring requires years of practice and dedication
Medieval texts described conjuring spirits through ritual ceremonies
The horror movie depicted dangerous consequences of amateur conjuring

definitions: physical link between things, especially electrical or communication systems
relationship in which a person, thing, or idea is linked to something else
person with whom one has social or professional contact
scheduled transport service enabling passengers to continue their journey
examples: Technicians checked all cable connections before activating the system
The wireless connection dropped repeatedly during the video conference
Investigators discovered a connection between the two seemingly unrelated crimes
Scientists established a clear connection between diet and heart disease
Her connections in the industry helped secure the business deal
Political connections often influence career advancement opportunities
Passengers missed their connection due to the delayed arrival
The airport offers convenient connections to major international destinations

definitions: word or phrase that links parts of text or discourse
tissue that connects, supports, or surrounds other tissues and organs
examples: Discourse connectives like 'however' and 'therefore' improve text coherence
Students learned to use temporal connectives in narrative writing
Connective tissue disorders affect multiple body systems simultaneously
Collagen is the main protein found in connective tissue

definitions: capacity for interconnection of platforms, systems, and applications
ability to connect to or communicate with computer networks
degree to which components of a graph or network are connected
examples: Modern smartphones offer multiple connectivity options including WiFi and Bluetooth
The car's connectivity features allow seamless smartphone integration
Rural areas still struggle with limited internet connectivity
The office upgraded its connectivity to support remote workers
Graph connectivity determines the network's resistance to node failures
Researchers analyzed brain connectivity patterns in autism studies
